alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cobb; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherokee, northern Cobb and north central Fulton Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 650 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Sandy Plains, or near Marietta, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, pea sized hail, heavy rain, and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Alpharetta, Smyrna, Dunwoody, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Acworth, Fair Oaks, Mount Bethel, White Water Park, Sweat Mountain, Oak Grove, Kennesaw State University, Sandy Plains, Dobbins Air Reserve Base and Vinings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
